tn.ref: Pi Hahiroth ... Migdol ... Baal Zephon
tn.text: These are towns on Egypt's eastern border. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: You are to camp
tn.text: Here the word "You" is plural and refers to Moses and the Israelites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: Pharaoh will say about the Israelites, 'They are wandering in the land. The wilderness has closed in on them.'
tn.text: This can be stated as an indirect quote. AT: "Pharaoh will say the Israelites are wandering in the land and the wilderness has closed in on them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])

tn.ref: The wilderness has closed in on them
tn.text: Pharaoh speaks of the wilderness as a person who has trapped the Israelites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues to instruct Moses on where to go and what Yahweh will do.

tn.ref: I will harden Pharaoh's heart
tn.text: Here "heart" refers to the Pharaoh. His stubborn attitude is spoken of as if his heart was hard. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:09:11|9:12]]. AT: "I will cause Pharaoh to became more defiant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: he will pursue them
tn.text: "Pharaoh will pursue the Israelites"

tn.ref: I will get honor
tn.text: "People will honor me"

tn.ref: The Egyptians will know that I am Yahweh
tn.text: "The Egyptians will understand that I am Yahweh, the one true God"

tn.ref: So the Israelites camped as they were instructed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "So the Israelites camped as Yahweh had instructed them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: When the king of Egypt was told
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "When someone told the king of Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: the king of Egypt
tn.text: This refers to Pharaoh.

tn.ref: had fled
tn.text: "had run away"

tn.ref: the minds of Pharaoh and his servants turned against the people
tn.text: Here the word "minds" refers to their attitudes towards the Israelites. AT: "Pharaoh and his servants changed their attitudes about the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: What have we done in letting Israel go free from working for us?
tn.text: They asked this question to show they thought they did a foolish thing. This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "We have done a stupid thing by letting Israel go free from working for us!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: He took six hundred chosen chariots
tn.text: "He took 600 of his best chariots" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: Yahweh hardened the heart of Pharaoh
tn.text: Here "heart" refers to the Pharaoh. His stubborn attitude is spoken of as if his heart was hard. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:09:11|9:12]]. AT: "Yahweh caused Pharaoh to became more defiant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: Pi Hahiroth ... Baal Zephon
tn.text: These are towns on Egypt's eastern border. See how you translated them in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:14:01|14:02]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: When Pharaoh came close
tn.text: The word "Pharaoh" here represents the entire Egyptian army. AT: "When Pharaoh and his army came close" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: they were terrified
tn.text: "the Israelites were terrified"

tn.ref: Is it because there were no graves in Egypt, that you have taken us away to die in the wilderness?
tn.text: The Israelites ask this question to express their frustration and fear of dying. This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "There were plenty of graveyards in Egypt for us to be buried in. You did not have to take us into the wilderness to die!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Why have you treated us like this, bringing us out of Egypt?
tn.text: The Israelites ask this question to rebuke Moses for bringing them to the desert to die. This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "You should not have treated us like this by bringing us out of Egypt!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Is this not what we told you in Egypt?
tn.text: The Israelites ask this question to emphasize that this is what they had told Moses. This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "This is exactly what we told you while we were in Egypt." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: We said to you, 'Leave us alone, so we can work for the Egyptians.'
tn.text: This can be stated as an indirect quote. AT: "We told you to leave us alone, so we could work for the Egyptians." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_quotations]])

tn.ref: Moses said to the people
tn.text: Moses responds to the Israelites' fears.

tn.ref: provide for you
tn.text: The pronoun "you" refers to the Israelites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: For you will never see again the Egyptians
tn.text: Moses used a polite way of saying God was going to destroy the Egyptian army. AT: "For God will kill the Egyptians" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: Why are you, Moses, continuing to call out to me?
tn.text: Moses apparently had been praying to God for help so God uses this question to compel Moses to act. This rhetorical question can be translated as a statement. AT: "Do not call out to me any longer, Moses." See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: divide it in two
tn.text: "divide the sea into two parts"

tn.ref: Be aware
tn.text: "Know"

tn.ref: I will harden the Egyptians' hearts
tn.text: Here "hearts" refers to the Egyptians themselves. Their stubborn attitude is spoken of as if their hearts were hard. See how you translated a similar phrase in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:09:11|9:12]]. AT: "I will cause the Egyptians to became more defiant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: so they will go after them
tn.text: "so that the Egyptians will go into the sea after the Israelites"

tn.ref: the camp of Egypt and the camp of Israel
tn.text: "the Egyptian army and the Israelite people" (UDB)

tn.ref: so one side did not come near the other
tn.text: This means that the Egyptians and the Israelites could not approach one another.

tn.ref: east wind
tn.text: An east wind originates in the east and blows towards the west.

tn.ref: east
tn.text: where the sun rises

tn.ref: the waters were divided
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh divided the waters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: on their right hand and on their left
tn.text: "on each side of them" or "on both sides of them"

tn.ref: He caused panic among the Egyptians
tn.text: Panic is when someone becomes so afraid that they cannot think normally.

tn.ref: Their chariot wheels were clogged
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Mud clogged their chariot wheels" or "Their chariot wheels were getting stuck in the mud" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Yahweh said to Moses, "Reach out with your hand ... and their horsemen."
tn.text: This can be stated as an indirect quote. AT: "Yahweh told Moses to reach out with his hand over the sea so that the waters would come back onto the Egyptians, their chariots, and their horsemen."

tn.ref: come back onto
tn.text: "fall on"

tn.ref: The Egyptians fled into the sea
tn.text: Since the sea was closing in on top of the Egyptians, instead of escaping, they were actually running right into the water.

tn.ref: Yahweh drove the Egyptians
tn.text: "Yahweh pushed the Egyptians" or "Yahweh threw the Egyptians"

tn.ref: Israel
tn.text: Each of the occurrences of "Israel" refer to the people of Israel. AT: "the people of Israel" or "the Israelites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: out of the hand of the Egyptians
tn.text: Here the word "hand" refers to power. AT: "from the Egyptians' power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: on the seashore
tn.text: "on the land along the edge of the sea"
